com.mikehelmick.proc

Class Proc

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.mikehelmick.proc.Proc
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    Example.ExampleProcess

    public abstract class Proc
extends java.lang.Object
    Extend this class to write your processes in the distributed system. Your process will receive periodic heartbeats (calls to the tick method). Message objects that are destined for your process will be sent via the receiveMessage method.

    Your process class must either be reentrant. The tick and receiveMessage methods may be called at the same time.

    Both tick and receiveMessage should execute quickly (well under a second). If you need to do long running work, consider starting a companion thread for each process, but ideally this will not be necessary.

    To send messages, use with the sendAll or sendOne methods.

    • Method Detail

      • tick

        public abstract void tick()
        Perform any computations that should be done that are not related to receiving a message. These computations should be very quick, ideally measured in milliseconds.

      • receiveMessage

        public abstract void receiveMessage(Message message)
        You are receiving a message. Process this message as appropriate for the algorithm that is being implemented. It is normal that receiving a message could cause messages to be sent or resources to be claimed.

      • getProcessId

        protected final java.lang.Long getProcessId()

      • getProcessCount

        protected final long getProcessCount()

      • sendAll

        protected final void sendAll(Message.MessageBuilder builder)
        Send a message, based on the passed in Message.MessageBuilder object to ALL other processes in the system (multicast).

      • sendOne

        protected final void sendOne(Message.MessageBuilder builder,
           java.lang.Long receiver)
        Send a message to a single receiver (unicast).

      • declareResourceOwnership

        protected final void declareResourceOwnership(Clock time,
                            int resourceNum)
        For resource mutual exclusion. Make a declaration that this process now owns this resource. Resources are numbered from 1 to the maximum number configured, available via ProcessManager.getSharedResouceCount.

        If the declaration is incorrect, an exception will be thrown and the simulation will halt.

      • releaseResourceOwnership

        protected final void releaseResourceOwnership(Clock time,
                            int resourceNum)
        Release the shared resource back to the resource pool. If you make a release but don't currently own the resource, an exception will be thrown.

      • declareConsensus

        protected final void declareConsensus(Clock time,
                    java.lang.String data)
        Declare that some consensus position (represented by the String data) is true. Useful for testing paxos implementations, amoung other things.

      • equals

        public final boolean equals(java.lang.Object other)

        equals in class java.lang.Object
